p: None of the mice that inhaled any of the tested formulations showed a significant increase in response time compared to animals that inhaled compressed air or vehicle, indicating the absence of antinociceptive activity ( Figure 2 and Table 3). This result is in accordance with previous work from Rao and coworkers [ 11], who reported that oral administration of breu essential oil obtained from P. heptaphyllum did not result in antinociceptive activity in the hot plate test.
